FuncDef:
The esn command configures equipment serial number (ESN) for an AP on a master.
The undo esn command deletes an ESN configured for an AP on a master.
By default, no ESN is configured for an AP on a master.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an ESN for an AP.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The port extension system supports plug-and-play (PnP) for an AP. After an AP starts, it automatically enables the data communication network (DCN) function and uses OSPF to advertise its ESN and initial PnP status. After a master discovers the AP and identifies the initial PnP status, the master checks whether the AP's ESN has been locally configured. If the AP's ESN has been locally configured, the master starts the PnP process. To enable a master to uniquely identify an AP, run the esn command on the master to configure an ESN for the AP.
Prerequisites
An ESN has been obtained from an AP.
Configuration Impact
After you run the esn command and the AP with the specified ESN goes online, the master starts the PnP process during which the master uses the preset password to connect to the AP over STelnet.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
